titles.title: Dǝrsanä Mikaʾel, Homiliary for the feasts of St. Michael / Mälkǝʾa Mikaʾel "Image of Michael"

shortcontents.shortcontent: I) Dǝrsanä Mikaʾel, Homiliary for the feasts of St. Michael (fols. 5ra-60ra) I-1) Introduction (fols. 5ra-7ra) I-2) Homily by Timothy (Dämatewos), [Patriarch] of Alexandria [for Ḫǝdar] (fols. 7ra-12ra); miracle (fol. 12ra-vb); commemorative notice (fols. 12vb-13ra); ʾarke-hymn (fol. 13ra-rb) I-3) Homily by Metropolitan Yoḥannǝs the Orthodox for the 12th of Taḫśaś [Miyazya] (fols. 13rb-16rb); miracle (fols. 16rb-17ra); commemorative notice (fol. 17ra-rb); ʾarke-hymn (fol. 17rb-va) I-4) Homily by an anonymous author for the 12th of Ṭǝrr [Taḫśaś] (fols. 17va-21va); miracle (fol. 21va-vb); commemorative notice (fols. 21vb-22ra); ʾarke-hymn (fol. 22ra-rb) I-5) Homily by an anonymous author for the 12th of Yäkkatit (fols. 22rb-24rb); miracle (fol. 24rb-vb); commemorative notice (fols. 24vb-25ra); ʾarke-hymn (fol. 25ra-rb) I-6) Homily by Yoḥannǝs [Severus], Metropolitan [Patriarch] of Antiochia for the 12th of Mäggabit (fols. 25rb-34va); miracle (fols. 34va-35rb); commemorative notice (fol. 35rb) I-7) Homily [by Epiphanius, Metropolitan of Cyprus] for the 12th of Miyazya [Ṭǝrr] (fols. 35va-39rb); miracle (fols. 39rb-40rb); commemorative notice (fol. 40rb-va); ʾarke-hymn (fol. 40va) I-8) Homily by Yoḥannǝs, Metropolitan of Ethiopia for Gǝnbot (fols. 40va-41vb); miracle (fols. 41vb-42va); commemorative notice (fol. 42va-vb); ʾarke-hymn (fols. 42vb-43ra) I-9) Homily by Yoḥannǝs, Metropolitan of ʾAksum (ʾAkwǝsǝm) for Säne (fols. 43ra-46vb); miracle (fols. 46vb-47vb); commemorative notice (fols. 47vb-48rb); ʾarke-hymn (fol. 48rb) I-10) Homily by Metropolitan Yoḥannǝs for Ḥamle (fols. 48rb-51rb); miracle (fol. 51rb-vb); commemorative notice (fols. 51vb-52ra); ʾarke-hymn (fol. 52ra-rb) I-11) Homily by an anonymous author for Näḥase (fols. 52rb-54rb); miracle (fol. 54rb-vb); commemorative notice (fol. 54vb); ʾarke-hymn (fol. 55ra) I-12) Homily by an anonymous author for Mäskäräm (fols. 55ra-56va); miracle (fol. 56va-vb); commemorative notice (fols. 56vb-57ra); ʾarke-hymn (fol. 57ra) I-13) Homily by an anonymous author for Ṭǝqǝmt (fols. 57ra-59rb); miracle (fol. 59rb-va); commemorative notice (fols. 59va-60ra); ʾarke-hymn (fol. 60ra) II) Mälkǝʾa Mikaʾel "Image of Michael" (fols. 60rb-63ra) III) Unidentified text (fol. 63rb-vb).

donors.donor: The following persons are mentioned in supplication formulas: Fǝśśǝḥa Giyorgis, Täsfa Giyorgis, Wälättä Maryam.

txstates.txstate: The upper right corner of the textblock has been eaten by rodents (a portion of the text is lost). The leather cover is partly detached from both boards. The board attachments have been crudely repaired by means of synthetic threads. Holes or tears amended e.g., on fols. 10, 23, 26, 28, 32, 42, 50, 52.

bindings.binding: Two wooden boards covered with reddish brown tooled leather. Two pairs of sewing stations.

bndecorations.bndecoration: Blind tooled ornament on the reddish-brown leather cover (at least 5 tools were used: double line fillet, double circle, x-from, double crescent, wave form with dots).

bnothers.bnother: Small holes are visible on the spine fold of the quires, close to the head and the tail of the codex. Fol. 62 is reinforced by parchment guards.

squires.squire: A(4/fols. 1r-4v) – I(8/fols. 5r-12v) – II(8/fols. 13r-20v) – III(8/fols. 21r-28v) – IV(8/fols. 29r-36v) – V(8; s.l.: 3, stub after 6; 6, stub after 3/fols. 37r-44v) – VI(8/fols. 45r-52v) – VII(8/fols. 53r-60v) – VIII(4/fols. 61r-64v)

taunit.rl-info: Pricking and ruling are visible. Ruling pattern: 1A-1A-1A1A/0-0/0-0/C. Primary pricks are visible. Ruling pricks are visible. The upper line is written above the ruling. The bottom line is written above the ruling.

pchangeofhands.pchangeofhand: It cannot be excluded that Text III was written in a different hand.

rubrications.rubrication: Nomina sacra; name of the protagonist; parts of the names of the donors; groups of lines on the incipit pages of Texts I-1 and I-2; incipits of all sections and subsections; elements of the punctuation signs; elements of Ethiopic numerals.

abbreviations.abbreviation: throughout Text I ለ፡ ዓ፡ አ፡ for ለዓለመ፡ ዓለም፡ አሜን፡ (e.g., fol. 7ra) ለ፡ ዓ፡ አሜ፡ for ለዓለመ፡ ዓለም፡ አሜን፡ (e.g., fol. 9va) ለዓ፡ ዓለ፡ አ፡ for ለዓለመ፡ ዓለም፡ አሜን፡ (e.g., fols. 21va, 57ra) ለዓ፡ ዓለ፡ አሜ፡ for ለዓለመ፡ ዓለም፡ አሜን፡ (e.g., fol. 17va) throughout Text II ሰላ፡ for ሰላም፡ ሚካ፡ for ሚካኤል፡

otherdetails.otherdetail: Text I-6 is not followed by an ʾarke-hymn as all other sections.

extras.extra: - Omitted letters or words are written interlineally: e.g., fols. 13ra, 18ra, 22rb. - Scribal mistakes are indicated by series of dashes or parallel lines around the erroneous word, in different hands: fols. 9ra, 17ra, 17va, 25va, 41ra, 55ra. - Corrections inserted interlineally, in recent hands: e.g., fols. 13va, 14ra, 60v, 61ra. - Crude drawings and scribbles: fols. 2r, 4v, 164rv.

txfindingaids.txfindingaid: - Monthly readings are indicated by the names of the months written in the upper margin: ዘኅዳር: fol. 7ra ዘየካቲት: fol. 22rb ዘመጋቢት: fol. 25rb ዘሰኔ: fol. 43ra (in the text) ዘነሐሴ: fol. 52rb ዘመስከረም: fol. 55ra ዘጥቅምት: fol. 57ra. There might have been indications also for the other months, written on the part of parchment eaten by rodents.

frames.frame: Fol. 5r (incipit page of Text I): simple ornamental band with one central pendant; interlaces and anthropomorphic motifs. The number ፩ (quire mark?) and several letters are written in the centre of the band.
